messageDestinationDTO Data Type

Holds information about message destinations. Message destinations are associated with actions so that when an action is triggered, a message is sent to the destination.

Namespace
(Default)
Properties
name data type type namespace min/max occurs description
destination_type int element 1/1 The type of the destination (e.g. queue or topic). See constDTO (message_destination_types property).
expect_ack boolean element 1/1 Indicates whether an acknowledgement is expected for this destination. If true, then the consumer of the messages sent to this queue must send a message to the "acks.." queue.
export_key string element 0/1 This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this field
id int element 0/1 The ID of the destination.
name string element 0/1 The visible name of the destination.
programmatic_name string element 0/1 The programmatic name of the destination. This is how consumers will identify the message destination when accessing the message broker.
users objectHandle element 0/unbounded The list of users which are permitted to receive messages in this message destination. Currently these users are only given read only access to the destination and write access to the ack queue (if it exists).
uuid string element 0/1 A unique identifier for this Message Destination.

Example

<messageDestinationDTO>
  <id>...</id>
  <name>...</name>
  <programmatic_name>...</programmatic_name>
  <destination_type>...</destination_type>
  <expect_ack>...</expect_ack>
  <users>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </users>
  <uuid>...</uuid>
  <export_key>...</export_key>
</messageDestinationDTO>
